qas.question: What type of government did the Puritan settlers establish?
By what year did the Puritan settlers rename the area from Quinnipac to Newhaven?
In what year was the northern area of New Haven renamed Hamden?
What colony was located to the north of New Haven Colony, centered around the area known as Hartford?
What did New Haven Colony not permit that principally distinguished it from Connecticut Colony?
In 1678 what was  the new name of the Northern part of New Haven?
New Haven Colony was separated from the Connecticut Colony which was located where?
What made New Haven different from the other colonies in Connecticut?
Where was the headquarters of the New Haven Colony located?

context: By <a1_0>1640<a1_0/>, the town's <a0_0>theocratic government<a0_0/> and nine-square grid plan were in place, and the town was renamed Newhaven from <a8_0>Quinnipiac<a8_0/>. However, the area north of New Haven remained Quinnipiac until <a2_0>1678<a2_0/>, when it was renamed <a5_0>Hamden<a5_0/>. The settlement became the headquarters of the New Haven Colony. At the time, the New Haven Colony was separate from the <a3_0>Connecticut Colony<a3_0/>, which had been established to the north centering on <a6_0>Hartford<a6_0/>. One of the principal differences between the two colonies was that the New Haven colony was <a7_0>an intolerant theocracy<a7_0/> that did not permit <a4_0>other churches to be established<a4_0/>, while the Connecticut colony permitted the establishment of other churches.
